appendix.title: Installing and Setting Up an ⪪ Server on the &admserv;
appendix.para: One way of providing the repositories needed to set up the nodes in &cloud; is to install an ⪪ server on the &admserv; and mirror all repositories from &scc; via this server. For further details and download information refer to .

sect1.title: ⪪ Installation
sect1.para: The &smtool; 11 SP3 can be installed as an add-on product on the &admserv; after the &slsa; 11 SP3 has finished.

step.para: Make the &smtool; 11 SP3 installation media #1 available on the &admserv;. This can be achieved by

listitem.para: inserting a CD to which the iso image has been burned
copying the iso image to the &admserv;

step.para: Select Add and choose the location of the installation source. If you have, for example, loop mounted the iso image, choose Local Directory and specify the path. Proceed with Next.
Read the License Agreement and accept it by selecting Yes, I Agree to the License Agreement. Proceed with Next.

The package manager will start. To optionally review the list of packages that is going to be installed, choose the Installation Summary view. To start the installation, choose Accept and then Continue.

sect1.title: ⪪ Configuration
sect1.para: After the installation has finished, the SMT Configuration Wizard will start. It allows you to configure access to the &scc; and set up the database.

step.para: Configuring the ⪪ server requires you to have your mirroring credentials (user name and password) and your registration e-mail address at hand. To access them, proceed as follows:
Open a Web browser and log in to the &scc; at .
Click your name to see the e-mail address which you have registered.
Clicking Organization Organization Credentials to obtain your mirroring credentials (user name and password).
Activate Enable Subscription Management Tool Service (SMT).
Enter the NCC Mirroring Credentials as follows:

simplelist.member: User: The user name you retrieved from the &scc;
Password:The password you retrieved from the &scc;

step.para: Enter the e-mail address you retrieved from the &scc; at NCC E-Mail Used for Registration.
Your SMT Server URL shows the HTTP address of your server. It should be necessary to change it.
Test your settings. The test will take up to several minutes. If it fails, check your settings.
Proceed to step two of the SMT Configuration Wizard with Next.
Enter a Database Password for SMT User and confirm it by entering it once again.
Enter one or more e-mail addresses to which ⪪ status reports are sent by selecting Add.

Write the ⪪ configuration with Next. When setting up the database, you will be prompted for the MySQL root Password. If you have already configured it earlier on, provide the existing password. Otherwise enter a new password. Note, that this is the global MySQL root password, not the database password for the SMT user you specified before.
The last step that is performed when writing the configuration, is a synchronization check with the &scc;. It may take several minutes until it is finished.
Finally, ⪪ is registered with the &ncc;. Select Next to start the registration. If it is successful, the ⪪ update repository will be added to the &admserv;.

sect1.title: Setting up Repository Mirroring on the ⪪ Server
sect1.para: The final step in setting up the ⪪ server is to configure it to mirror the repositories needed for &cloud;. The ⪪ server mirrors the repositories from the &scc;. In order to access them, make sure to have appropriate subscriptions registered in &scc; with the same e-mail address you have specified when configuring ⪪. For details on required subscriptions refer to .

sect2.title: Adding Mandatory Repositories
sect2.screen: for REPO in SLES11-SP3-{Pool,Updates} SUSE-Cloud-5-{Pool,Updates}; do smt-repos $REPO sle-11-x86_64 -e done

sect2.title: Adding Optional Repositories
sect2.para: The following repositories are only required if wanting to install the respective optional functionality:

listitem.para: &slsa; 12 repositories are needed if you plan to deploy &compnode;s running &slsa; 12. Run the following commands as user &rootuser; to add them to the list of mirrored repositories:
listitem.screen: for REPO in SLES12-{Pool,Updates} SLE-12-Cloud-Compute5-{Pool,Updates}; do smt-repos $REPO sle-12-x86_64 -e done

listitem.para: For the optional &hasetup; you need to mirror the SLE HA 11 SP3 repositories. Run the following commands as user &rootuser; to add them to the list of mirrored repositories:
listitem.screen: for REPO in SLE11-HAE-SP3-{Pool,Updates}; do smt-repos $REPO sle-11-x86_64 -e done

listitem.para: The &storage; repositories are needed if you plan to deploy &ceph; with &cloud;. Run the following commands as user &rootuser; to add them to the list of mirrored repositories:
listitem.screen: for REPO in SUSE-Enterprise-Storage-1.0-{Pool,Updates}; do smt-repos $REPO sle-12-x86_64 -e done
